intro: Cuspidaria cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf cuspidaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, powdery coating that gives them their distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
